creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Coring War Hammer
description:
A giant hammer than when it strikes, can create a 10 block pillar. Creating the pillar is up to the wielder and you must be attuned to are war hammer.

If a creature is struck and a pillar made, the creature must pass a dexterity check against the damage dealt, or be raised on the pillar.

If the pillar hits a ceiling, any creature on the pillar takes 4d6 bludgeoning damage.

The pillar is always perpendicular to the ground where it originated.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: scribbled notes
description: What appear to be research notes from the Idoru Academy.
note:
Notes are in Ancient; Draconic, Deep Speech, Primordial, and Celestial make it generally understandable.

Informs the reader of the names of the types of crystals.

The Citizen - Blue
The Crafter - Green
The Composer - Orange
The Curator - Red

The Conformist - Lime

Little is known of the Gold & Silver crystals, they are the only known stable results of combining crystals, but the exact conditions for combining the crystals seem incidental and inconsistent.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Encyclopedia Collection from Idoru Academy
description: What appear to be a collection of encyclopedias from the Idoru Academy.
note:
Notes are in Ancient; Draconic, Deep Speech, Primordial, and Celestial make it generally understandable.

These encyclopedias contain information on various topics and concerns of magic, helping clarify some points of how magic works at a fundamental level, but will take decades to understand.

Once understood, some basic things that can be determined;

+ Provides instructions for Crystal liquification

These notes describe how to grow a crystal and creating a basic vial, which involves melting down a crystal with acid, force, and fire elements, then dividing the crystal pieces into a vial and describes how a host can grow a crystal and the effects were excessive growing can be hazzardous to the health.

Also noting that Gold and Silver crystals are still not entirely understood and do not appear to observe the same properties.

+ (Requires Large Crystal Refining) - Flight with crystals
+ (Requires Large Crystal Refining) - Larger force fields for protecting cities or boats with crystals
 
+ Improved spell casting (From level higher cast per day with a crystal in inventory)

+ With 2 other Ancient sets, can learn Ancient with 100 hours of reading with 3 sets.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Spear Sling
description:
While equipped, you may have 6 spears readied to be equipped or thrown.

If your currently equipped weapon is a spear or javelin, you can place it in the sling if changing weapons. Otherwise you must drop your current weapons or spend an action putting your current weapons away.

If you are merely throwing a spear or javelin from this sling, the attack uses an action as normal, or bonus action if some effect is allowing you to attack with a bonus action.

This sling replaces your usual "12 studs" of readied weaponry, where a spear or javelin normally count as 4 to 5 studs in size each.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Readied Spear Sling
description:
While equipped, you may have 6 spears readied to be equipped or thrown. These spears are kept more ready than usual through magical enchantments once the sling is attuned to you, allowing you to throw to attack as an action or bonus action.

If your currently equipped weapon is a spear or javelin, you can place it in the sling if changing weapons. Otherwise you must drop your current weapons or spend an action putting your current weapons away.

Due to the enchantment, you may throw a spear or javelin from this sling to attack as an action or a bonus action.

This sling replaces your usual "12 studs" of readied weaponry, where a spear or javelin normally count as 4 to 5 studs in size each.

This sling does not let you attack normally with your bonus action.
hiddenDescription: A spear sling whose pouch has a faint white glow.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Encyclopedia Collection from Aixer
description: What appear to be a collection of encyclopedias from the Aixer Tomb.
note:
Notes are in Ancient; Draconic, Deep Speech, Primordial, and Celestial make it generally understandable.

These encyclopedias contain information on various topics and concerns of magic, helping clarify some points of how magic works at a fundamental level, but will take decades to understand.

+ Provides instructions for Large Crystal Assembly

These notes describe how to create a large crystal by melting them down and then applying pressure with force magic to hold it together while using cold magic to resolidify it.

Also noting that Gold and Silver crystals are still not entirely understood and do not appear to observe the same properties.

+ (Requires Crystal Liquification) - Imbue a weapon with crystal properties
+ (Requires Crystal Levitation) - Weightless Items

+ Improved skill checks while holding a crystal of the correct alignment.

+ With 2 other Ancient sets, can learn Ancient with 100 hours of reading with 3 sets.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Ipse Doll
description:
Commonly known now as the "Doll of Self" in modern myth, the doll takes the form of a miniature version of the person holding it.

While you feel where and how you are holding the doll, the doll also reveals magical effects on you with various colors and magical effects when examined.

Though some things shown are hard to see, an investigation check is needed to make out all the effects, and some effects may be hidden by other magics.

The doll requires no attunement and will reflect whoever is holding it after 1 minute (10 rounds).
hiddenDescription:
Common:
Self (Ipse | Latin)
note:
Occasionally other effects are shown on the doll as an effect of the user's disposition, so panic may show as another effect similar to a charm spell and be hard to discern.

On investigating the doll, a critical fail results in a curse as your eyes get lost in the magical effects fluttering around the doll.

The creature that failed gains the effect "Egotistical" and has a disadvantage on all charisma related checks and saves until their next long rest.

on investigating the doll, a critical fail results in a curse as your eyes get lost in the magical effects fluttering around the doll.

the creature that failed gains the effect "egotistical" and has a disadvantage on all charisma related checks and saves until their next long rest.doll

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Compass of Ambition
description:
Points to that which you most desire.

When waking from a long rest, name the desired creature or item.
hiddenDescription: A seemingly broken compass that appears to be spinning and randomly pointing in various directions.
note:
Takes a percentile check after a long rest;

00 - 10: Curse of desire, points toward nearby dangerous creatures.
11 - 20: Roll 1d8, points in that cardinal direction permanently.
21 - 100: If an creature or object was named completely and correctly, points towards the object requested by the player.

The desired thing must be in this plane of existence for the compass to point at it.

However, if a portal is opened to the needed plane of existence, will point to the portal.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Blessed Dream Rose
description:
When acquiring the rose, must past a wisdom save (DC:18) or become irrevocably attached to possessing the rose. After becoming attached to it, can attempt to drop or giving it away once per long rest against another wisdom check (DC:21).

When sleeping, you always dream and the rose is always present in your dreams. Sometimes good, sometimes bad. You roll a percentile every long rest.
hiddenDescription: A radiant rose, with many spines along its stem.
note:
The blessing of on the rose is from Zeus. His choatic neutral nature showing in how the rose manifests its effects against the one bound to it.

The effect of the rose, varies;

00 - 10: Chaotic Effect
11 - 30: Mallidiction Effect
31 - 60: Neutral Effect
61 - 90: Beneficial Effect
91 - 100: Lawful Effect

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Fucott's Scryglass
description:
A spy glass with a range of 800 studs to see clearly, and an additional 200 studs decent vision where you can see but have a disadvantage on any skill checks done through the spyglass.

When looking through the Scryglass, speak the command word to mark a creature in your view, immediately consuming a charge. You must keep the target in view of the Scryglass for 30 seconds (5 rounds). If the target is lost, the charge is stilled consumed.

For the next 10 days you may use this to scry on the marked creature.

Losing attunement clears the mark against that creature.

A perception check may allow the creature to know it has been marked, but it must have an intelligence of 6 or greater to be able to notice.

Scry is subject to the usual possibility of being resisted or spotted based on the item's indicated DC.
hiddenDescription: An ornate spyglass that seems to have magnificent zoom.
note:
The command word is "Fuck You" and when spoken has a chance to offend anyone in listening range, possibly provoking an attack against the person using the item.

Can only provoke 1 person into an actual attack.

Everyone provoked must pass a wisdom save against the item's DC or be forced to attack the user at least once, lasting for 6 rounds. If the target for the provoked is unreachable, the provoked screams and yell while trying to lunge, jump, or escape any confides.

The provoked will also ignore all threatening barriers, such as damaging terrain, cliffs, etc. But will attempt to navigate them if acceptable, ie. achievable within the remaining time.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Potion of Dissolution
description:
Can use a charge to dissolve an item of up to a size of 2 cubic studs. This includes corpses and rocks. Living flesh is however fairly resilient and enchanted items and clothing will essentially provide immunity to this potion.

Can use multiple charges at a time to dissolve larger objects.

The liquid, even if the vial is fully emptied, will regenerate slowly when you rest.
hiddenDescription: A mystical looking black and deep blue liquid swirl in the potion vial.
note:
There is no good way to cork this liquid and it will slowly occasionally dissolve small items in your inventory.

If it's in a bag of holding, it only effects items in the bag of holding, but will not effect itself.

If put away with no cork, stil regenerates but will spill out and immediately consume a portion of the inventory.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Night Die
description:
The Night Die is a fortune telling die that can predict safety during sleep.

When rolled and a charge is used, it foretells what will happen, though reading it may be a bit of a challenge s the language it foretells in can change.

A charge can not be used by someone to which the die is not attuned (Must be equipped to your pouch).

It is easy to know when the foretelling has failed from the extreme headache you will experience, and you can expect nightmares that night.

Can only use 1 charge per day.
hiddenDescription: Mysteriously black twelve sided die with no symbols or runes. Each side is merely a smooth black surface.
note:
The Night Die is the result of an experiment in divination with the power crystals.

The infusion with the power crystals resulted in the die speaking in ancient, but since the responses are one word, it cycles between Ancients base languages.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Alchemical Air Condenser
description:
A complex and delicate item meant for use with an alchemy kit.

It's design and material make it resistant to the elements such as fire, acid, or poison and many others. These resistances allow it to condense those elements from the air and distil them to something that the alchemy kit can use.

However, using this item adds complexity to the process of using the alchemy kit, the difficulty check (DC) for this item must be rolled along with any alchemy checks.

This item can condense a a general area of elemental air, or 1 spell cast of dragonborn breathe, to 1 unit of usable elemental liquid and consumes 1 charge per use.

The precision of the instrument however makes it only usable against standing terrain or from willing creatures.
note: x

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Black Veldýr Statue
description:
Used to summon a Veldýr. Whether it works or not depends on how loyal the Veldýr is to you.

If not loyal, the Veldýr can be summoned once a day and roll a d10 to see how long it can stay out.

If the Veldýr is fully loyal to you, once summoned it can stay out forever and for an action can be returned to its status state.
hiddenDescription: A small statue of a black cat with glowing green eyes.
note:
Once attuned, every long rest roll a percentile and a d10. On rolling above the current loyalty, the Veldýr gains the d20 in loyalty toward you and you can summon it that day.

If you roll a percentile below it's loyalty, it hisses at you and you can not summon it that day.

Once it is fully loyal, the eyes stop glowing and sit as a translucent green.

When summoned while not fully loyal, a d10 is rolled and it can stay out for up to it's loyalty divided by 10 hours or the roll of the d10, whichever is lowest.

if you roll a percentile below it's loyalty, it hisses at you and you can not summon it that day, but you gains the d20 in loyalty toward you.

once it is fully loyal, the eyes stop glowing and sit as a translucent green.

when summoned while not fully loyal, a d10 is rolled and it can stay out for up to it's loyalty divided by 10 hours or the roll of the d10, whichever is lowest.elemental

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Contract: Assassinate Qua Silverborn
description:
# Assassination Contract:

+ Target: Qua Silverborn
+ Requestor: Anonymous
+ Required Completion Date: 13th of Vaknaevum
+ Reward: 5000 Gold

## Details

An anonymous source has requested this and the large sum has made this somewhat of a priority for the guild. Bring this contract with the target's head per the usual channels.

It is expected that you will meet resistance from the Draconian Army and the Cortexian Protectorate. The death of these guards is not required and will not yield any bonus payment.

## Current Intel

The guild's spies have Qua in the city of Indium on the continent Turrija. The cold season in Dormevum and Alucevum may help with sneaking into the city.

We believe he will be staying there until around the 1st of Vaknaevum, when we believe he will be returning to Draconia, possibly stopping somewhere in Mikillaellera.

He is certainly under Draconia escort and with a diplomatic party. And from what we can tell, the assassination request does not involve the diplomatic mission, so to avoid drawing to much attention, avoid disrupting diplomatic affairs.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Spectral Bean
description:
Spectral "Beans" can be identified by their multi-colored exterior of reds, blues, and green or yellow.

Consuming this bean pushes you to the [Ethereal Plane](:::/knowledge?id=knowledge:plane:ethereal) where you can walk around.

While in the ethereal plane, you can not interact with the material plane.

For this, you gain the effect "Ethereal" for 1 minutes (10 rounds).

+ If the bean has not turned, a successful DC check allows you to stop and end the ethereal effect at will for the duration. If failed, you are stuck in the Ethereal Plane for the entire 10 minutes.
+ If the bean has turned, a successful DC check limits your time in the Ethereal Plane to 10 minutes and a failed DC cause you to be stuck in the Ethereal Plane for 1 hour.
hiddenDescription: Spectaled with Green, Red, Blue, and White coloring, this bean shaped thing is a mystery to you.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Spiritual Bean
description:
Spiritual "Beans" can be identified by their flat white exterior.

Consuming this bean allows you to see the souls of the dead that still linger in the plane on which you reside. The length of time that the spirit noticeably lingers varies by the spirit and only indicates that the spirit's body has not been dead for longer than a year.

And while a body may move, a spirit will almost always linger where its body fell.

You ability to interact with the spirits will vary.

+ If the bean has not turned, a successful DC check causes the spirit to perceive you as their best friend (If they had one) and you should be able to hold the spirit's attention for at least 2 questions, even if you provoke it. On a failed DC, you appear as yourself to the spirits.

+ If the bean has turned, a successful check yields the above failed check, and on a failed DC, you appear as the spirit's worse enemy, if they have one. If they do not have an enemy, you appear as yourself but the spirit has distrust toward you.

You always have at least one 1 question. Though provoking the spirit will cause it to ignore you immediately. This also includes any party members the spirit might find "offensive".

Usually after 3 questions, the spirit grows bored or too distracted to maintain conversation.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Verd Bean
description:
Verd "Beans", literally Green Beans in Draconic, can be identified by their flat green exterior.

When consumed, you gain a green glow and have vague properties of a green power crystal.

Additionally, you gain the ability to commune with the plants around you.

+ If the bean has not turned; On a successful DC, you can speak briefly with the plants, getting simple answers to basic questions for some time. On a failed DC, you can intuit senses from the plants to give you bonuses when checking things that they might know.

+ If the bean has turned; a Successful DC allows you to intuit the plant growth, and a failed DC gives no additional effects.

In all cases, you gain a +1 bonus to perception when near plants.

If you are a druid, you get +1 to your Spell DC.

If you are a ranger, you get +1 to your attack rolls in terrain with plant growth.

Ambula "Beans", can be identified by their flat blue exterior.

In all cases, you also receive a +1 bonus to insight checks.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Castupravus
description:
An ornate holy weapon seemingly from the gods. You can feel the divine energy within simply by holding it and it is almost overwhelming in its power. It has golden inlays and several words engrained along the sides:

+ Castus
+ Athena
+ Daminoth
+ Serinal
+ Zeus
+ Dionysus
+ Lucian
+ Cthulhu
+ Pravus

You feel the weapon radiating with divine energy simply by holding it.

Depending on your alignment, adds an additional 2d8 of damage.

+ Good: ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Radiant"}$
+ Neutral: ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Force"}$
+ Evil: ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Necrotic"}$
hiddenDescription:
A giant 2 handed hammer with golden inlays and several words engrained along the sides:

+ Castus
+ Athena
+ Daminoth
+ Serinal
+ Zeus
+ Dionysus
+ Lucian
+ Cthulhu
+ Pravus

You feel the weapon radiating with divine energy simply by holding it.
note:
Name roughly derived from "Holy Evil".

If you have not prayed to the Hammer before using it that day, you take 1d4 psychic damage from the hammer for every attack. If you do not currently worship a god, this damage is Doubled. This happens regardless of attunement.

If you strike someone who worships the same God as you or who has the same alignment as you, you take 1d4 psychic damage from the hammer for each attack.

If you do not worship a god, you take 1 psychic damage every hour.

All conditions above trigger individually and thus can stack.

Additionally, the hammer counts as an additional entity that you are now worshiping. This may cause issues with some gods or vows.

Any holy symbols you may have are inert while you are attuned to Castupravus. This hammer is now a holy symbol for you.

Note that your God may reject you for some of these conditions, which would revoke your status as worshiping them.

Unattuning from this item requires a successful Wisdom save and a successful Religion check.

A failed Wisdom save results in you continuing to carry the hammer and a sense of impending doom filling your body.

A failed religion check after a successful Wisdom save causes you to fall dead immediately. You can still be resurrected as usual.

Can be attempted every ${7,orange}$ days.

description:
A simple magical carpet that can hover above the ground by up to 20 studs depending on the weight it is carrying.

Speak the command word "${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Volant"}$" to use a charge and start the carpet flying for at most 4 hours. The command word maybe spoken again while the carpet is active to extend the active time by another 4 hours.

If the person who activated the carpet loses consciousness, the carpet deactivates and begins a slow decent to the ground.

Weights
+ < 100 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 15 Stud Move, 20 Stud Hover
+ 100-200 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 10 Stud Move, 10 Stud Hover
+ 200-300 ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 5 Stud Move, 5 Stud Hover
+ 300 + ${"class":"rs-orange","content":"Blocks"}$: 0 Stud Move, 0 Stud Hover

name: Aelestrcra
description:
Aelestrcra is a Great Axe forged with pieces of red crystals forming the head of the blade. While the crystal pieces do not seem to have energy in the way a power crystal does, the pressence has left a strong enchantable pressence.

You may consume a single charge per turn for any one of the below benefits:
+ Switch the attribute of the Axe from Strength to Dexterity or vice versa.
+ Reroll an ${"content":"Attack","class":"rs-orange"}$ roll or ${"content":"Religion","class":"rs-orange"}$ check.
+ Roll an additional ${"content":"1d8","class":"rs-orange"}$ of ${"content":"Force","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage. This damage would double as part of a critical and this can only be used after you know if you've hit the target or not.
+ Be able to pass through ${"content":"Red Barriers","class":"rs-orange"}$ for ${"content":"10","class":"rs-orange"}$ rounds.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Spatium
description:
A simple silver amulet with an inlaid blue gem.

If any effect is about to fade, you can use a charge to persist that effect for either its maximum duration, or, if it is about to fade, to extend the duration one round.

Charges can be used at anytime and in any amount.

For example, if a Barbarian enters Rage and it's about to fade, a charge could be used to make it last the full 10 rounds.

Or, if Shield of Faith is about to fade, a charge could be used to have it last another round to get 11 rounds instead of 10.

This can be applied to any effect upon your person.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Wazos Stein
description:
A very heavy dwarven stout known to get the brain thinking so to speak. A common drink among smithies and clerics. As long as you've got some thinking to do, it makes it easier to not become completely inebriated.

On 3 successful saves, you receive some odd insight into a thought you're having.

On 2 failed saves, you become drunk.

On 4 failed saves, you pass out for 4 hours and forget everything that happened since you started drinking. At a DC15 investigation, a failed check leads the creature investigating to believe you are dead.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Uncandle
description:
A black 1 stud tall candle with black wax that has a single golden rune inlaid at its base.

This candle is lit by the shadow of any kind of kindling (Typically found in a ${"text": "Traveler's Kit", "class": "rs-orange"}$).

Once lit, this candle burns for 3 hours, creating a sphere with a radius of 20 studs in which there is utter darkness.

While "lit", the wax of the candle slowly melts similar to a normal candle.

The candle can be pinched to stop the darkness, but it will also stop when there is no wax left.

Note: You will have to track the candle manually.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Frozen Candle
description:
A blue 1 stud tall candle with blue wax that has a single golden rune inlaid at its base.

This candle is immune to cold damage and can only be lit by freezing the wick.

Once lit, this candle "burns" for 3 hours, creating a thunderous blizzard in a 1 mile radius.

While "lit", the wax of the candle slowly melts similar to a normal candle.

The wick of the candle "burns" until the wick is warmed. Using your hands to do so will cause you to take 1 point of cold damage. Using an item, may cause that item to freeze or suffer a similar effect.

The blizzard affects the lands until the wick is put out or all the wax is gone.

Note: You will have to track the candle manually.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Inkarian Blade
description:
A large double sword in the style of the Inkarian Warriors, a center piece of their aggressive and reckless style of fighting.

When attacking with this blade, you may use a charge once per round to do another attack with this sword. This may also be used during reactionary attacks.

When you use a charge, the rate at which you may critical fail an attack doubles for that fight as you exhaust yourself with the motion.

For example, you normally critically fail an attack on a roll of a 1, however after using a charge, you now critical fail on a 2 for that attack and for the rest of that fight. If you use it again during that fight you now fail on a 4, then an 8, and so on.

Once the fight ends, your critical failure range for attacks returns to 1.


Because of the large size of this blade, when wielding this large double ended sword, critical fails always result in you awkwardly throwing the sword and the next attack against you is with advantage.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Scorpion's Pain
description:
A special heavy shield with the image of a scorpion on the shield.

When absorbing damage, add the amount of damage absorbed as charges to the shield to its max.

As a reaction to being struck with a damage type absorbed by this shield, you can expend all the charges as bludgeoning damage to the attacker regardless of distance from the attacker. Use this after absorbing the damage from the incoming attack.

Additionally, you may spend an action to take a defensive posture. When done, this shield acts to block ranged attacks going past you. When stuck, double the damage blocked (4d4) but you only absorb half (Rounded down).

name: Note to Ranger
description:
If you're reading this note, then you're definitely tracking us.

We're here to deal with the pirates, so if you're not a pirate, please stop trying to kill us.

Sincerely,
Ash the necromancer

P.S: If you die, can I have your bones.

P.S.S: Could've trapped this, but didn't. So definitely not trying to kill you.
note: You pondering stumbling across this note in your pocket... When'd this get here...?

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Arcane Society Initiate Book
description:
# Initiate Hand Book

As an initiative, you have some access to parts of the Arcane Society with this book.

# Regulations

All books and tools must stay on the island without special permission from the Leoterrian magistrate. The main desk can help with reaching out to the magistrate.

# Library

The library is the center of the Arcane Society and highly guarded. Follow the instructions of your guides.


# Research

Your research is noted in the central arcanous and will grant you access to relevant information.

Your research assignment has been noted as ${"content":"Illusion Magic","class":"rs-orange"}$ and how ${"content":"Power Crystals","class":"rs-orange"}$ effect it, particularly in combat.

# Assignee

This book is assigned to ${"content":"Orla","class":"rs-orange"}$ .

Note that this book is magically bound to you to prevent any theft or cloning.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: The History of Vaminan Mathle
description:
The book covers the history of ${"content":"Vaminan Mathle","class":"rs-orange"}$ the Accountant.

Rising to power, he climbed over the corpses of other crime bosses in ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$. As the elves of ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$ established a government across the country, he retreated to the wilds. Boats served to keep his network of loans running smoothly, often hiding information in plain sight. 

While not the only financier, he quickly became the most powerful with a hand on approach, ensuring his ventures succeeded by murdering, bribing, and lying.

After 9 years, he ventured back to ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$ for a venture in magical enchantments that had hit a road block from the government regarding the risk it posed to the surrounding city. An associate of his was caught trying to bribe a Coneixian surveyor and in the investigation the Coneixian officials locked down the ports preemptively, easily leading to Vaminan's capture in his ensuing panic.

After his capture, his accounts were meticulously tracked down collected, leading to the fall of several criminal organizations. Historians tend to credit his fall to the rise of the current ${"content":"Theive's Guild","class":"rs-orange"}$, though it is believed that they took a fairly large hit to their operations as well.

To this day, criminal organizations tend to avoid having any base of operations in ${"content":"Coneixager","class":"rs-orange"}$ as the Coneixians maintain strict borders and have since maintained a process of quickly locking down towns when criminal activity is being investigated.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Cieo
description:
A small arcane enchantment serves to isolate any magical effects to a pocket dimension. This will prevent magical enchantments like ${"content":"Alarm","class":"rs-orange"}$ from notifying the enchanter.

The small light power of the enchantment makes it difficult to detect but also makes it hard to use. With limited charges and a bit of arcane handling skill needed to handle the gloves. Fortunately the wearer knows if the pocket dimension is ready before attempting to use the enchantment but it is only good for 10 minutes and needs 5 minutes before it can be used again.

The user must pass a ${"content":"DC:10 Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ check to create a stable pocket dimension.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Trifulla
description:
A large, heavy three bladed axe with an enchanted green blade for one of the heads.

When swung, the weight  shifts and adds to the power behind the swing, however control can also be loss easily.

However, the weight also makes it easier to deal impressive amounts of damage with every swing.

And a charge may be expended when leading with the green blade to deal additional ${(str/2)d4,darkorange}$ poison damage to the target.

This weapon critical fails on 1-4 and critically hits on 19 & 20.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Harbinger
description:
A specialty piece signed under the trigger as created by ${"content":"Via","class":"rs-orange"}$.

An extremely heavy crossbow that gives off a dark purple shadow around itself. Each shot requires and consumes a charge from the crossbow as well as needing special ammo to fire it.

Despite its weight, the crossbow does not hinder movement. Though it is almost impossible to hide, leading anyone who sees you to be skeptical of your intentions.

Those hit must pass a DC${10 + int,darkorange}$ Constitution or  Wisdom save or be cursed, gaining the ${"content":"Harbinger's Curse","class":"rs-orange"}$ effect.

Shots from this crossbow may deal additional damage depending on the bolt used.
note:
The dark corruption flowing through the crossbow requires souls to satiate it.

The corruption speaks to the attuned user, asking for blood, generally for the attuned's, amounting to 1HP on waking from a long rest. If this isn't fulfilled, all attacks from this crossbow are at a disadvantage until the ritual is completed.

If it does not take a life every week, it deals ${10d10,darkorange}$ Necrotic damage to the attuned creature when it wakes at the start of the next week. If this would kill you, pass a ${DC15,darkorange}$ Constitution save to remain conscious.
_search:

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Spell Copying Inkwell
description:
A magical inkwell used for copying spells from your ${"content":"Spellbook", "class":"rs-orange"}$ to a ${"content":"Scroll", "class":"rs-orange"}$ or vice versa.

To copy a spell, you will need a number of inkwells equal to the level of the spell multiplied by itself. So a level 1 spell requires 1 kit, a level 3 spell requires 9 kits, and a level 9 spell requires 81 kits.

If you are a Wizard and possess an ${"content":"Alchemy Kit", "class":"rs-orange"}$, you may perform an DC${20-int,darkorange}$ Alchemy Kit check for this kit to count as 2 kits instead of one. If you are using more than 2 kits, perform this check twice:  
0. All kits are used to copy the spell
1. You use 3/4s of the kits rounded up
2. You use 1/2 of the kits rounded up
note: Used for copying spells

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Scroll of Arcane Portcullis
description:
Concentrate on and name a creature that is on your current plane of existence. That creature then suddenly appears at a location of your choice within ${30,darkorange}$ studs of your current location.

The named creature performs a DC${19,darkorange}$ Wisdom save against this scroll. If it succeeds,  it may choose to accept the summoning.

If you are not able to cast level 9 arcane spells, you must pass a DC${19,darkorange}$. On a failed check, the spell still casts, but the target automatically succeeds their wisdom save and knows your location.

[ ${Level,darkorange}$:${9,darkorange}$ ]

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Corruption Stone
description:
Used in advanced enchanting recipes, the enchanter attuned to the stone and wears it on their person for 10 days to slowly learn of the inner workings of the arcane magic within, performing a DC${15,darkorange}$ Arcana check every morning.

After 10 days and 6 successful Arcana checks, the stone can be used in enchanting.

The danger of powerful enchanting stones however is that the user risks negative magical effects against themselves, and anyone can attune to and learn of the stone, not just an enchanter.

name: Witch's Broom
description:
Once attuned to the broom, a creature may concentrate on the broom and pass a DC${18-wis,darkorange}$ Arcana check to activate the broom for 1 hour, allowing the attuned creature to fly on the broom.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Mutus Candle
description:
A blue 1 stud tall candle with blue wax that has a single golden rune inlaid at its base.

This candle is lit normally by fire.

Once lit, this candle burns for 3 hours, creating a sphere with a radius of 20 studs in which there is no sound.

While "lit", the wax of the candle slowly melts similar to a normal candle.

The candle can be moved after it's been lit but it can not be put out. Pinching it results in ${1d4,orange}$ or Fire damage.

Note: You will have to track the candle manually.
note: Reaches around corners to fill the radius if it can, otherwise cut off.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Note on Arcane Crystal Research
description:
The colors of the arcane are diverse but not all crystals are needed; ${"content":"Red", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, ${"content":"Blue", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, and ${"content":"Green", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ seem to serve as the most basic of components and our research has shown that we can create the ${"content":"Lime", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ and ${"content":"Orange", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ crystals from them but ${"content":"Silver", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ still eludes us.

We have some information on how to create a ${"content":"Gold", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ crystal but have yet to test the proposed theory.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Tabbelt
description:
Once worn and attuned the belt fades and the attunee grows a cat's tail, granting advantage on acrobatics checks.

As long as the tail is visible, the attunee is also friendly with all small wild cats. Larger wild cats will remain cautious but are more likely to attempt to communicate.

Charges may be spent to reroll any dexterity saving throw.
hiddenDescription: Appears to be made out of the tail of a large cat
note:
Wisdom saving throws to avoid meowing in the middle of conversations.

Wisdom save is based on remaining charges.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Simple Deck for Fish's Bet
description:
A simple desk for playing Fish's Bet. The basic rules are written on the case.

Each Player has 5 cards
Can ask questions:
+ How many (Paris/Triplets/Quadruplets) do you have?
+/- 1
+ What is the total of your hand?
+/- 5
+ How many (Hearts/Diamonds/Spades/Clubs) do you have?
+/- 1
+ How many (Black/Red) cards do you have?
+/- 2

The +/- range is how much you’re allowed to lie.

If you roll a percentile below it's loyalty, it hisses at you and you can not summon it that day, but you gains the d20 in loyalty toward you.

Once it is fully loyal, the eyes stop glowing and sit as a translucent green.

When summoned while not fully loyal, a d10 is rolled and it can stay out for up to it's loyalty divided by 10 hours or the roll of the d10, whichever is lowest.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Research Journal: Reading Ancient
description:
A research journal that seems describes someone's research into how to read ${"content":"Ancient","class":"rs-orange"}$. While there are many notes of things tried and failed, the final useful entry reads as such...

# 15 Unkulevum 316
Discovering that the ${"content":"Ancient","class":"rs-orange"}$ language is a cipher instead of a language has proven useful to finding things that do not work but progress has been made.

Empowering a ${"content":"Comprehend Language","class":"rs-orange"}$ ritual by modifying the arcane sigils and adding empowering runes seems to have helped, some pieces of the text have become vaguely readable to me.

It would seem that not only is it a cipher, but it is composed of multiple languages and I believe the total count to be 4. However finding the combination of languages is proving difficult as the empowered ritual circle takes several hours to complete and another day to use.

See me if you wish to attempt the ritual, the circles and runes are in my personal bindings.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Weaver's Wraps
description:
A pair of blue wraps meant to be worn around one's forearms, they grant better control over your movements.

Over time, you find your hands become more nimble, allowing you to perform various feats, but the nimbleness fades after doing so.

You may spend any number of charges to perform any of the below:
+ ${1,orange}$ Charge: Pick an item up from the ground as a ${"content":"Bonus Action", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ ${2,orange}$ Charges: Throw a weapon that is not normally throwable to a range of your strength modifier times 10 studs (${str * 10,orange}$).
+ ${3,orange}$ Charges: Gain advantage on a ${"content":"Slight of Hand", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ check
+ ${4,orange}$ Charges: Gain advantage on an ${"content":"Acrobatics", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ check
+ ${5,orange}$ Charges: Double the outer throwing distance (Where at disadvantage) of a thrown weapon
+ ${7,orange}$ Charges: Double the inner throwing distance of a thrown weapon
+ ${10,orange}$ Charges: Disengage from a creature for free
+ ${15,orange}$ Charges: Take a second attack with your main hand, only when you've just attacked with your main hand. This can be used multiple times.
+ ${20,orange}$ Charges: When attacking, roll a second D20 and add it to your attack roll.
+ ${30,orange}$ Charges: When attacking with your main hand, double the damage dealt. If you landed a critical hit, this doubles the result of the critical damage.
note: Story:ToGive

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Night Die
description:
The Night Die is a fortune telling die that can predict safety during sleep.

When rolled and a charge is used, it foretells what will happen, though reading it may be a bit of a challenge s the language it foretells in can change.

A charge can not be used by someone to which the die is not attuned (Must be equipped to your pouch).

It is easy to know when the foretelling has failed from the extreme headache you will experience, and you can expect nightmares that night.

Can only use 1 charge per day.
hiddenDescription: Mysteriously black twelve sided die with no symbols or runes. Each side is merely a smooth black surface.
note:
The Night Die is the result of an experiment in divination with the power crystals.

The infusion with the power crystals resulted in the die speaking in ancient, but since the responses are one word, it cycles between Ancients base languages.

An ancient relic blessed by ${"content":"Dionysus", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ himself.

While attuned with this relic, you may use a charge to make a religion roll, testing your connection with ${"content":"Dionysus", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$. If you do not worship him, you do not add your ${"content":"Religion", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ modifier. This roll can not fail.

( ${"content":"Rolled Value", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ x ${"content":"6 Seconds", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ Time ).

An ancient ring instilled with arcane powers through means that have long since been forgotten, sharpening the wears vision and wits.

The shadows of the night become perceptible to you and your sight has clarity many times greater than you would normally.

In combat, the charges have many uses:
+ ${1,orange}$ ${"content":"Charge","class":"rs-darkorange"}$: Critical hit with a ${16,orange}$ or higher
+ ${2,orange}$ ${"content":"Charges","class":"rs-darkorange"}$: You may move ${Triple,orange}$ your ${Walk/Run,orange}$ distance for your movement.
+ ${3,orange}$ ${"content":"Charges","class":"rs-darkorange"}$: Add ${5,orange}$ to your ${Armor/AC,orange}$ rating as a reaction until your turn.

Out of combat, the sharpened wit continues to give the ring uses:
+ ${1,orange}$ ${"content":"Charge","class":"rs-darkorange"}$: Automatically succeed a ${Wisdom,orange}$ save
+ ${2,orange}$ ${"content":"Charges","class":"rs-darkorange"}$: You may reroll a ${Perception,orange}$ check
+ ${3,orange}$ ${"content":"Charges","class":"rs-darkorange"}$: Add ${5,orange}$ to an ${Insight,orange}$ check.

name: Zwa

Ancient Elven bracers made for a great warrior who's spirit seems to reside inside.

At the start of any fight, you may make a ${Constitution,orange}$ DC${20-wis,orange}$ save. On success, you take no damage from using charges.

+ ${2,orange}$ Charges: Critical on a roll of ${19,orange}$, however your roll total must still hit
+ ${4,orange}$ Charges: Ignore the target's armor and automatically critical

If you have not made a successful ${Constitution,orange}$ save, you take 1d8 ${Psychic,orange}$ damage for each charge used.

This applies only to weapon attacks and not to spells.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Andiziyo
description:
Seemingly just the hilt of a blade. As you examine it, the hilt produces an energy like blade. A culmination of the souls of all the creatures its slain, the blade of this dagger is a long purple beam. The beam giving no resistance or weight, causing it to behave like a dagger instead of a swird.

At the beginning of combat, make a ${Constitution,orange}$ DC${20-level,orange}$ save. On failure, using this blade causes 1d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage with every strike as the blade drains your life force to power itself. Alternatively, a ${"content":"Red","class":"rs-red"}$ or ${"content":"Blue","class":"rs-blue"}$ ${"content":"Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ may be attached to the blade to satisfy the needs of the blade.

If a crystal is attached, roll 1d12 at the end of any combat. On a ${12,orange}$, the crystal shatters.

When a creature is slain by you, its life force is absorbed by this blade. This hilt is treated as the corpse of the dead for the purposes of things like ${"content":"Speak with the Dead","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ or ${"content":"Gentle Repose","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

When striking, charges can be expended from the hilt to various effects:
+ ${1,orange}$ Charge: Add ${1,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage
+ ${2,orange}$ Charges: If you've managed to hit, the hit is a critical hit
+ ${3,orange}$ Charges: Add ${3*wis,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage

If this blade is used while not attuned, the creature using the blade takes ${4,orange}$d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage for every attack.
hiddenDescription: A purple runic handle with runic symbols inlaid along the hilt.

Dust slowly fills the pouch using the excess energy from the attuned creature.

When a creature is exposed to the dust, it must make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${8 + wis,orange}$ save or forget the last ${minute,orange}$ from its memory.

Any creature effected by forgetfulness has its memory restored when exposed to a Level ${3,orange}$ or higher healing spell.

description: While heavier than it looks, this cape allows the attuned to become invisible for a period of time equal to your ${Wisdom,orange}$ Modifier (${wis,orange}$) in hours when a charge is used. This invisibility is ended when you take any Action. Use of multiple charges does not stack, the invisibility merely ends the duration of time from the last used charge. If the cape is and removed while the invisibility is active, the invisibility ends, and the cape can be removed by force while you are invisible. The invisibility does not extend to any other creature, regardless of that creature's position to you.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Cape of Skulking
description:
While heavier than it looks, this cape allows the attuned to become invisible for ${1,orange}$ hour and helps obscure your pressence.

If the cape is and removed while the invisibility is active, the invisibility ends, and the cape can be removed by force while you are invisible.

The invisibility does not extend to any other creature, regardless of that creature's position to you.

name: Dust of Pixies

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Serinal's Blessing
description:
An ancient relic blessed by ${"content":"Serinal", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ herself.

The number of charges available is equal to your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ (${wis,orange}$) Modifier + your ${"content":"Intelligence","class":"rs-orange"}$ (${int,orange}$) Modifier.

While attuned with this relic, you may use a charge to succeed a ${Wisdom,orange}$ or ${Intelligence,orange}$ save instead of rolling. Once rolled, you can not use a charge.

Additionally you can use ${2,orange}$ charges to recover a Level ${1,orange}$ spell slot.

If you are a follower of ${"content":"Serinal", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, you may additionally use ${4,orange}$ charges to recover a Level ${2,orange}$ spell slot.
hiddenDescription: A holy symbol but the details of it are unknown.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Wandering Dust
description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${20,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${20*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Durong's Blessing
description:
An ancient relic blessed by ${"content":"Durong", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ himself.

While attuned with this relic, you may use a charge to empower a cast spell, ${Doubling,orange}$ the damage it deals.

If the spell heals, or does not do damage, a charge has no effect.

The number of charges is equal to your ${Intelligence,orange}$ Modifier and your ${Charisma,orange}$ Modifier influences how long it takes to recharge.

If you are a follower of ${"content":"Durong", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$, the damage from the spell is ${Quadrupled,orange}$ instead.

When a charge is used from this blessing, blood slowly gushes forth from your eyes and your skin pales. Your vision remains mostly clear through the effect, merely making ${Perception,orange}$ checks more difficult, but your aspect becomes almost frightening. The duration of the aspect effect depends on the number of charges used, but usually lasts for an hour.
hiddenDescription: A holy symbol but the details of it are unknown.
note:
${"content":"Durong", "class":"rs-darkorange"}$ being an evil god, use of this relic lets him see you clearly and slowly corrupts the creature using it to evil.

If the creature is already evil, this has no effect.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Wandering Dust
description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${20,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${20*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: The Rising Dawn's Fang
description:
A Short story about a Vampire's love for a mortal and the town who cursed him.

The story unfolds as he struggles with his lust for revenge and his love for the woman as she and her family try to persuade the town of his innocence.

Building to a grand fight of trial by combat between the town's sheriff and the vampire, the vampire wins and the town yields the vampire's innocence.

While reveling in their love, the vampire returns to where the crime he was accused of occurred and reminisces about drinking the blood of his lover's sister.

Several years pass before he is discovered, fleeing into the northern mountains of Luperio.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Nature of the Power Crystals
description:
The Power Crystals are elements of nature that form from raw arcane energy in the world, collecting in the ground and gathering like any other crystal.

# Names

Each color has its own properties and quirks and has earned itself a name:
+ ${"content":"The Citizen","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - Blue
+ ${"content":"The Crafter","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - Green
+ ${"content":"The Composer","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - Orange
+ ${"content":"The Curator","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - Red

And while generally part of the ${"content":"Power Spectrum","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ of the represented colors, the Lime behaves differently, seeming to behave like any of the other crystals with the right arcane knowledge earning it the title of "${"content":"The Conformist","class":"rs-darkorange"}$".

# The Spectrum

Each color has dual meanings, granting to the properties of the crystals and the colors of magic.

![The Power Spectrum](/images/dnd/color_alignment_v_small.png)

# Uses

Every crystal has a variety of uses and can be blended with its piers for differing effects.

Ideally this is through the use of magic, via arcane runes and incantations, however it can also be managed through small contraptions and enchantments.

And while uses through enchantments have been some what learned, the use of the crystals directly has been limited to only their passive effects, the result of them being near by. 

Other effects have merely been observed from other beings in the world, such as the ${"content":"Kintari","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, wielding multiple power crystals in intricate arcane power circles around their arms to greatly empower their magic. But while observed, very little about it is understood.
_search:
nature of the power crystalsitem:book:powercrystals:naturethe power crystals are elements of nature that form from raw arcane energy in the world, collecting in the ground and gathering like any other crystal.

# names

each color has its own properties and quirks and has earned itself a name:
+ ${"content":"the citizen","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - blue
+ ${"content":"the crafter","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - green
+ ${"content":"the composer","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - orange
+ ${"content":"the curator","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ - red

and while generally part of the ${"content":"power spectrum","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ of the represented colors, the lime behaves differently, seeming to behave like any of the other crystals with the right arcane knowledge earning it the title of "${"content":"the conformist","class":"rs-darkorange"}$".

# the spectrum

each color has dual meanings, granting to the properties of the crystals and the colors of magic.

![the power spectrum](/images/dnd/color_alignment_v_small.png)

# uses

every crystal has a variety of uses and can be blended with its piers for differing effects.

ideally this is through the use of magic, via arcane runes and incantations, however it can also be managed through small contraptions and enchantments.

and while uses through enchantments have been some what learned, the use of the crystals directly has been limited to only their passive effects, the result of them being near by. 

other effects have merely been observed from other beings in the world, such as the ${"content":"kintari","class":"rs-darkorange"}$, wielding multiple power crystals in intricate arcane power circles around their arms to greatly empower their magic. but while observed, very little about it is understood.book

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Basic Alchemy Reference Index
description:
Contains minor recipes and break downs for how to use ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundles","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

After some extensive reading, one could learn to use those bundles with an ${"content":"Alchemy Kit","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ to create potions.

Due to the complexity of usage of the ingredient bundles, it can take sometime to acquire more complicated recipes and despite the recipes here-in, actually learning them without this book and being able to create them prove difficult.

# Recipe Appendix

The recipes here-in can eventually be learned with some effort, most involving a key ingredient. Until learned, the general recipe is the key ingredient plus 10 ${"content":"Alchemy Ingredient Bundles","class":"rs-darkorange"}$:
+ Water Breathing Potion: ${"content":"Aigua Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ Minor Healing Potion: ${"content":"Sana Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ Poison Remedy: ${"content":"Venom Sac","class":"rs-darkorange"}$
+ Smoke Bomb: ${"content":"Autus Leaf","class":"rs-darkorange"}$

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Rodious Repellous
description: A simple liquid for repelling rodents. Seems to work on those of Threat 1 or lower, with some exceptions. Extremely hostile or threatened creatures may risk crossing any boundaries created. No guarantees on threats of death if crossed. In some cases, rodents may enlarge to that of unusual size and become more threatening than before. If infestations last longer than 4 weeks, consult a local adventure for durther assistance. Clerics should be made aware of any other purchases that may have been used and rogues should be informed of any expensive items that may be at risk for additional protection. LG Breweries can not be found at fault for any poorly laid barriers.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Visis Candle
description:
A bright white 1 stud tall candle with white wax that has a single golden rune inlaid at its base.

This candle lights normally but can not be extinguished once lit. Works under water and in rain. Attempting to put it out with fingers results in no damage.

Once lit, this candle burns for ${3,orange}$ hours, creating a sphere with a radius of ${20,orange}$ studs in which any invisible creatures are revealed, and with a ${"content":"Perception","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ check, items and creatures in the ${"content":"Ethereal Plane","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ can be seen.

While "lit", the wax of the candle slowly melts similar to a normal candle to indicate the remaining time the candle has left.

This candle does NOT reveal through magical darkness. For example, the ${"content":"Uncandle","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ would still obscure anything this candle may reveal.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Soulous Restivous
description: Written in ancient, this Tome outlines the highest level of manipulating souls for the purposes of returning them to the material plane. The maximum number of charges present is equal to your Intelligence Modifier (${int,orange}$) plus your Wisdom Modifier (${wis,orange}$). In addition to the usual cost of Spell Ink to copy spells, a charge must be used for every level of the spell as well. While you possess and can read this book, charges may be used in conjunction with a spell slot of the appropriate level to cast the spell without it being known to you or contained actively with-in your Spellbook. Additionally, you are extremely proficient with a Healer's Kit and can not fail except on a natural ${1,orange}$.
hiddenDescription:
A holy-esq book with the arcane color spectrum connected on its cover.

You are familiar with what the title looks like but not of how to read it or what it means.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Ikatibha
description: Mythical Elven staff crafted by a sect of cat worshipers deep in a forest. The head of the staff is adorned with an intricately carved head of a cat and lightly meows when listened to carefully. A creature using this staff who does not like cats suffers ${6,orange}$ points of Psychic damage at the start of every hour. While equipped and attuned, you are able to speak with any cats you can see fluently, the staff translating for you. Anyone listening would hear you in your chosen language and simply hear "meows" from the cat. You may also use an action to transform yourself and your equipment to and from the form of a Cat, making your size tiny, but your movement speed remains. While in the form of a cat, any damage taken is against your health pool but does not dispell the form. However a Dispell Magic cast will disperse the transformation (Treating your change of form as a level 3 spell). And for general purposes this effect shows as Transmutation magic. Any attacks you make use your equipped items when determining if you hit (This leaves your attack roll as usual), but ignore your equipped items when determining damage. You instead deal your Dexterity Modifier (${dex,orange}$) in Slashing damage. Your attacks receive no damage bonuses. Any other items you have equipped can be used as long as the usage does not require your usual humanoid body. Some skills may be adapted, such as Sleight of Hand, for pawing at or moving things. You can not pick up items or remove items from your bag in cat form. Additionally, other creatures are also unable to reach into your bag. If you fall unconscious, you revert to your humanoid form. You may use your Bonus Action to Leap (In either Humanoid or Feline form), allowing you to scale high walls easily and to travel your full movement distance through the air, which avoids Difficult Terrain and other ground level objects, possibly including obstructions. When attempting to scale or go over hgih objects, an Acrobatics check is used with the difficulty scaling with the obstacle size.
note:
Elvish for "Catbar"  
Cat: ikati  
Bar: ibha

Created by the Inkanti-olo, the cat religion of the Wood Elves who would commune with the larger beasts and have a connection with the Veldyr.

name: Anija's Tabbelt
description:
Once worn and attuned the belt fades and the attunee grows a cat's tail, granting advantage on acrobatics checks.

As long as the tail is visible, the attunee is also friendly with all small wild cats. Larger wild cats will remain cautious but are more likely to attempt to communicate.

Charges may be spent to reroll any dexterity saving throw.

Wisdom saving throws to avoid meowing in the middle of conversations.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Tarot Deck
description: A tool of deceit or vision, this deck is imbued with magical energy to predict a target creature's fortune. As you flip the cards, you read the creature its fortune. Several skills may be used to invoke this deck's power; If using a charge, the fortune may possess truth and an Arcana or Religion check is used with each turn of a card to determine the accuracy of what you see. Whether you used a charge or not, you may then use a Persuasion or Deception check to convey information to the creature. This may be true or false information. However, depending on the information being sought and the target creature, there may not be a choice to the skill checks. The difficulty of foreseeing is determined by the creature and the cards drawn, along with what you speak as you foretell the creatures fate. These checks can not critical fail or critically succeed, they simply measure the impact. Attempting to read a fortune without attuning results in ${(wis+cha)d6,orange}$ Psychic damage. Can be combined with a Diving Kit to learn additional information in some cases.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Divnina Arcana
description:
A hefty book with a golden binding that has several decorative silver veins running along it, making patterns close to vines along the cover, back, and spine.

It is written in Ancient and is filled with symbols, runes, and power circles that seem to aid in translating Divination like spells to Arcane, and vice versa.

With some understanding of this text, it is possible for a Cleric or Paladin to learn new spells from a Wizard, and vice versa.

The text is extremely complex and intricate and will likely take quite some time to understand.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Aevium Orbis
description: A complex arcane ritual and powerful runes adorn this scroll, outlining a 4 hour procession of events to achieve the spell, including ${12,orange}$ power crystals; 4 Red, 4 Blue, and 4 Green, as well as the sacrifice of at least 4 living humanoid creatures totaling 50 years of age or more, every year beyond 50 reducing the toll on the creature performing the ritual. If you can not normally cast a level ${10,orange}$ spell, you must pass a ${35,orange}$DC Arcana check is performed to control the spell and direct the temporal bubble it creates. Additional blue crystals can be used to help control the bubble, every additional Blue Power Crystal reducing the DC by ${1,orange}$. Once successfully performed, a small localized area up to ${10 + wis,orange}$ studs in diameter can be shifted through time, causing everything inside to age forward or backwards up to a millennia in the span of ${1,orange}$ minute. If the creature performing the ritual fails the initial Arcana check, they and the sacrifices are cast back from the power circles and suffer 100d10 Necrotic damage. If a creature dies from this, its soul is bound to the realm of the lost and it is considered to have been dead for a millennia though it will not decay as such. Succeed or fail, all power crystals used disintegrate at the start of the ritual, their dust swirling in the power circles drawn on the ground. Once performed, and the ritual complete, the caster must succeed on a ${25,orange}$DC Intelligence save, or their soul is consumed with the others as part of powering the time dilation bubble. The sacrifices provided lose their souls, this may include the caster as noted above. These creatures are considered soulless and dead, their aging and rotting the span of time that the time dilatation bubble spanned. No spell or effect can stop this death. If they are revived by exemplary outside reactionary conditions, their bodies are considered soulless, mindless, and undead and will slowly die from lack of blood flow, oxygen, water, or food as they have no functional brain with which to perform necessary functions.

A book that helps the person holding the book recall information from their memories, causing them to appear in the pages of the book as something that can be read by any.

name: Scroll of Scrying
description: If you can not normally cast a level ${5,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, you can see and hear a particular creature you choose that is on the same plane of existence as you. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, which is modified by how well you know the target and the sort of physical connection you have to it. If a target knows you’re casting this spell, it can fail the saving throw voluntarily if it wants to be observed. Knowledge Save Modifier + Secondhand (you have heard of the target) +5 + Firsthand (you have met the target) +0 + Familiar (you know the target well) −5 + Connection Save Modifier + Likeness or picture −2 + Possession or garment −4 + Body part, lock of hair, bit of nail, or the like −10 On a successful save, the target isn’t affected, and you can’t use this spell against it again for 24 hours. On a failed save, the spell creates an invisible sensor within 10 studs of the target. You can see and hear through the sensor as if you were there. The sensor moves with the target, remaining within 7 studs of it for the duration. A creature that can see invisible objects sees the sensor as a luminous orb about the size of your fist. Instead of targeting a creature, you can choose a location you have seen before as the target of this spell. When you do, the sensor appears at that location and doesn’t move.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Scroll of Hold Monster
description: If you can not normally cast a level ${5,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${17,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, choose a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed its saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. This spell has no effect on undead. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another save, ending the spell early on success. Succeed or fail at casting the spell, you take 1d4 of Psychic damage. The paralysis expires after 2 rounds. The runes here-in work to counter the concentration requirements of the true spell, allowing it to be cast but not to be effectively copied as this is a tarnished version of the spell.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Umoya Crystal
description:
Soul gems are known from old dark magic, little is known about them other than they hold the soul of a dead creature and can be used in alchemical and arcane rituals.

With the right handling, the soul can be released from the gem.
hiddenDescription: A violet gem with a low dark glow.
note:
Successful arcana check against the gem can release the soul or summon it back into its body if the body is present.

If the gem is empty, it can be used at half it's DC to resurrect a creature who has been dead for less than 1 minute.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Speech Pills of the Outer Realms
description: Pill to learn a new language. The general instructions are listed in several languages, including common, however the ritual listed seems to require understanding Ancient to perform accurately, but enough is explained to try. If you don't understand Ancient, make a Wisdom DC${25,orange}$ Save. On success, you learn a language of your choice from below. However a critical failure will result in your brain being overwhelmed and you will take 5d10 Psychic damage. If you do understand Ancient, you may simply choose a new language to learn. Learn one of the languages of the lower realms, The Fey Wilds, Shadowfell, The Aether, and The Great Plains, listed below: + Sylvan + Druidic + Deep Speech + Kintarian
hiddenDescription: Some weird symbols mark the box, they appear to be in ancient.
note: Inscriptions match the languages on the outer mid-level wrap of  the Citadel entrance

name: Scroll of Arc Field
description: If you can not normally cast a level ${4,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Scroll of Spellsiphon
description: If you can not normally cast a level ${6,orange}$ spell, you must pass an Arcana DC${15,orange}$ check to successfully use the scroll, or else the cast fizzles expending the scroll. On a successful cast, you interrupt another spell caster's spell. If that spell is cast at the level of your cast of Spell Siphon or lower, the spell is Siphoned. Once a spell is siphoned, you know of the spell and must choose new target(s) for it and you are considered the caster of the new spell. If the spell is higher than your cast level, make an Intelligence save against the casted spell. For example, casting this at ${6,orange}$th level vs a ${8,orange}$th level spell is a DC of "${13,orange}$ + (${6,orange}$ - ${8,orange}$)" for a DC of ${15,orange}$. For another example, casting this at ${6,orange}$th level vs a ${7,orange}$th level spell is a DC of "${13,orange}$ + (${7,orange}$ - ${6,orange}$)" for a DC of ${14,orange}$.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Byrjaren Bracers
description:
Dwarven bracers forged with inlaid golden runes. Allows the wearer to instantly recall a thrown weapon and the weapon will teleport back to their hand.

Must recall the weapon within ${6,orange}$ seconds and their is no distance limit on recalling the weapon.

If the weapon is surrendered instead of thrown, it can not be recalled.

If the weapon is unintentionally dropped or stolen, it can be recalled.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Vo Soi Sin
description:
Can be filled with sea water and hums gently when full.

Once per long rest when successfully striking a creature, you may opt to use a charge to empty the stored sea water into the target for an additional ${(pro)d4, orange}$ Sonic damage.

The dagger can be filled even when a charge is not available but it does still hum gently.
hiddenName: Simple Dagger with a Seashell Hilt
hiddenDescription: A nicely balanced dagger that has a seashell for a hilt.
note:
The Merfolk of the Capoe Sea have taken an interest in the happenings above with the awakening of Waitiri's temple.

Fish and other sea creatures and gently drawn to the dagger when it is humming. The effect is amplified when in the water and results in a disadvantage on aquatic stealth rolls.

The Merfolk King uses this to scry above, but expected the Kintari to take it and they did not.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Lost Journal
description: Written in common the journal is easily read. The journal seems to be the last few weeks of a man named Iqoli. Most of the entries seem to be regarding his normal life in Somewhere in Draconia, but at some point he notes that he was walking through the town square and suddenly found himself here. Running through the vast plains he struggled to stay alive, burying himself in the sands to sleep to protect himself from the creatures above and eventually stumbling onto some demons who seemed to pay him no mind and followed them back to a city, letting them clear the way. Reaching the city he found the Soul Speech Amulet being sold at LemSim that would let him speak with the ghosts and he had hoped that he could use that to speak with them to find a way out, though he notes the shop keeper seemed to think that a crazy thought. To buy the necklace he needed gold or Umoya Crystals, and it would seem that 10 crystals would do the trick. Spending the last few gold coins he had to purchase some weapons seems to be the last entry.
note: DC15 to Determine where in draconia the man was from: Simer

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Diggers Journal
description: Written in Sylvan, this journal is a bit tricky to read if the language is not spoken. ---- Seems to be the journal of a digger from the Fey Wild who came here in search of some kind of ancient treasure. ---- There are tombs scattered about the continent where the ancients laid some of the "celebrities" to rest along with some of their valuables for them to take into the after life. ---- These tombs are quite well guarded, spirits are bound to them and the celebrities themselves are present, though not likely to be much of a threat themselves. Some areas also protected by puzzles and riddles, leading to secret passages and such as well. ---- Evens and odds seem to be of note in some tombs. Not sure in what way though... may warrant more investigation... --- Golems seem pretty common for defending... Watch the floor, color seems to change and need interrupted somehow... Definitely don't let it turn white --- Got a ghost to talk that knew a bit about the tombs. Managed to learn that if you die in the tomb, it'll kick your spirit out. Gotta remember to leave some stuff outside the tomb in case my spirit needs to grab it... --- Searching through the book you find descriptions of the location of a tomb to the northeast. Requires a Navigation check DC${10,orange}$ to locate the tomb. Can be performed once per long rest. --- Searching through the book you find descriptions of the location of a tomb on the southeast coast. Requires a Navigation check DC${15,orange}$ to locate the tomb. Can be performed once per long rest. --- Trying a tomb I stumbled on, not sure how to note this location, no features seem to be near by. Hopefully manage to finish before a ghost grabs my stuff.... --- And that seems to be the end of it. Though after reading through some of the foot notes, it would seem he used Elixir or Morletum to speak with the dead.
hiddenDescription: A thick book that will take some time to read if you can figure out the language and how to read it...
note:
DC15 navigation to find a map, one check per day.
 - Ancient Tombs (Location of 2: Set wherever)
    - location:tomb:ancient:0
    - location:tomb:ancient:1

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Explorer's Journal
description: A thick book that will take some time to read if you can figure out the language and how to read it... Writing comes off as a bit pompous and full of himself. Reading through it with Comprehend Languages, you make out some of the text. --- Large and extensive, seems to cover the journeys of a Kenku named Carian Lightfoot who came to this realm in search of a lost city. --- The journal notes the Pillar of Resurrection and that the living can pay the Ferryman a Coin of Styx to cross that a feat of strength and intellect must be passed to return to the material plane. Though the location of arrival is noted as "wonky". Though this is not ultimately what he was searching for. However, he doesn't seem to note where this pillar is located. --- He flies over the city of Stjornu noting that it appeared boring and of little interest. --- Noting the small islands he seems to have written out a way to find the lost city of Vefsioni on one of the islands. He writes at some length about the issues with the "Dead Sea" and that crossing without the assistance of the Ferryman is considered impossible, but simply flying over the sea should be quite easy... This is the last entry in the journal.
hiddenDescription: A journal of some kind currently encased in a magical matrix.
note: Current: 54 Investigation: [0] Written in Auran, this journal is a bit tricky to read if the language is not spoken. (Using Comprehend Languages to read) [70] It would seem that the book is instilled with a kind of signal that can be felt while holding it once the full book has been read. A Navigation check DC${20,orange}$ might reveal where he thought the city to be located, but attempting to discern this information seems to be protected. There appear to be ${3,orange}$ attempts at discerning the location remaining before the impression fades...

description: Bears a mark on the first page: Beyond that, you've learned some things by investigating the book...
hiddenDescription: A strange book that has a notable symbol on the first page: That aside, you're not able to distinguish this ancient book from the others. You suspect that you'll need to be able to read ancient to understand it.
note:
Found in the ruins of Hwand in a government records building.

Has level 10 conjuration, abjuration ,and divination magic on it. Successfully dispelling any of them results in a recasting of it by the conjuration magic, DC40 investigation magic to distinguish them, 4 of them all cast to maintain all other spells, 4 successful dispells targeting each individually has a chance at working.

Investigation Rolls - Currently ${0,orange}$
+ 25: The writing  actually appears to change in some cases
