creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Red Rock Rider
description: While holding this orb, you are compelled to go to the nearest creature and punch it. If there are multiple creatures near-by of seemingly similar range, roll a D20 for each until you roll higher than 10, then you travel at max speed (Including abilities and items) and punch that creature. When punching a creature, you deal an additional 6d6 Bludgeoning and 6d6 Lightning damage and feel a surge of pleasure from striking that creature. To release the ball, you must pass a Wisdom Save at DC${18,orange}$.
hiddenDescription: Black lightning appears frozen within the smooth red crystalline surface of this ball. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
note:
If attuned to the ball, the creature punches for 12d6 in each category instead, but retains the crazed drive. Additionally, unattuning causes that damage back upon the creature.

The max range for sensing a creature is visual. To tame the orb, a creature must isolate itself for 15 days within a meditation circle, then the Wisdom saves and crazed drive are gone.

Holding the ball with anything short of 1 inch of lead or at least 3 studs of pole still gives influence.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Royal Cloak
description: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. Having invoked Legend Lore, against this cloak, you've learned its history; That it was worn by someone who seemed to be an aid to the king, consulting with the royal family and helping to move things around the castle. As the visions continued, the castle appeared to be under attack, guards busily running down hallways and a familiar chaos in the rooms. As the vision came to an end, it was noted that the aid, with a dozen others from the castle, had retreated into the cellar area and hid where the cload was found. A bright shining creature of seemingly pure energy the last sight of those in the room, a flash of light the only scene between the aid in the room and Quincy retrieving the cloak.
hiddenDescription: A simple cloak bearing a insignia on it. Found in Hwand.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Temporal Knot
description: A powerful runic enchantment encloses a half green, half blue, power crystal atop a golden chain. While attuned, you may use the charges to manipulate localized small fragments of time within range. In Combat, you may use a charge to re-roll your Initiative or to have another creature re-roll its Initiative. This can only be used at the start of a round after you know who the current first creature of the round is. A charge can also be used as a Reaction to have any creature in combat re-roll an Attack, Damage, or Saving Throw roll. Outside of combat, this can be used to have any creature re-roll a performed Skill Check. Because of the temporal distortion, this occurs with no save. However some creatures may be resistant to this occurring with varying levels of awareness to the distortion occuring.
hiddenDescription: A runes encloses a half green, half blue, power crystal atop a golden chain.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Spirit's Vow: Purrsalot
description: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver that you know to read "Sir Purrsalot" and a small cat toy dangling from it. While attuned to this bracelet, you perform an Animal Handling skill check every morning, adding the rolled value to this item's charges. Once at 100 charges, a spirit cat appears for you; Sir Purrsalot. After appearing, you continue to perform an Animal Handling every morning, but this now determines what Sir Purrsalot will do that day: + Critical Failure: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, all creatures can hear him and all creature can see him. Even if the bracelet is unattuned, he will continue to exist and pester you, even through your sleep, should you manage to sleep. + 0-5: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, however only you can see or hear him. When you attempt to sleep, roll a d100 for every hour you are asleep, on a 20 or less, Sir Purrsalot wakes you by pawing your face, distinctly asking for food. + 6-10: Quietly stalks the area around you looking for treats or presents. His posture will change depending on how he feels or if he's found something. + 11-15: Sits on your shoulder and purrs. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws. + 15-20: Sits on your shoulder and purrs and others see him as a stark white cat in adorable armor. Giving you advantage on Wisdom and Charisma saving throws as well as Persuassion checks. + 21-30: Sits on your shoulder and purrs but will assist in combat. You have advantage on Wisdom and Charisma and in combat Sir Purrsalot will join the fray dealing 1d4 Slashing damage and moving around the field distracting enemies. Sir Purrsalot is immune to physical damage and can only be removed by being dispelled or other high level manipulation magic. Usually resulting in him simply returning to your shoulder. + 31+: Sir Purrsalot lounges on your shoulder and you are able to speak with him in Common. Any requests of him will depend on his mood and how you've treated him. Gain the effect Purring Cat when appropriate.
hiddenDescription: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver and a small cat toy dangling from it...
note: Made in Reykurax
_search: spirit's vow: purrsalotitem:spiritsvow:purrsalota silver bracelet with a blue power crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver that you know to read "sir purrsalot" and a small cat toy dangling from it. while attuned to this bracelet, you perform an animal handling skill check every morning, adding the rolled value to this item's charges. once at 100 charges, a spirit cat appears for you; sir purrsalot. after appearing, you continue to perform an animal handling every morning, but this now determines what sir purrsalot will do that day: + critical failure: spends the day following you around meowing for food, all creatures can hear him and all creature can see him. even if the bracelet is unattuned, he will continue to exist and pester you, even through your sleep, should you manage to sleep. + 0-5: spends the day following you around meowing for food, however only you can see or hear him. when you attempt to sleep, roll a d100 for every hour you are asleep, on a 20 or less, sir purrsalot wakes you by pawing your face, distinctly asking for food. + 6-10: quietly stalks the area around you looking for treats or presents. his posture will change depending on how he feels or if he's found something. + 11-15: sits on your shoulder and purrs. giving you advantage on wisdom and charisma saving throws. + 15-20: sits on your shoulder and purrs and others see him as a stark white cat in adorable armor. giving you advantage on wisdom and charisma saving throws as well as persuassion checks. + 21-30: sits on your shoulder and purrs but will assist in combat. you have advantage on wisdom and charisma and in combat sir purrsalot will join the fray dealing 1d4 slashing damage and moving around the field distracting enemies. sir purrsalot is immune to physical damage and can only be removed by being dispelled or other high level manipulation magic. usually resulting in him simply returning to your shoulder. + 31+: sir purrsalot lounges on your shoulder and you are able to speak with him in common. any requests of him will depend on his mood and how you've treated him. gain the effect purring cat when appropriate.made in reykuraxbracelet

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Bracelet of Foresight
description: Silver runes line the deep blue band of this bracelet, allowing the wearer to change the fate of creatures around them. When a creature in range rolls to deal Damage, whether by Attack or Spell, you may use a charge to have any creature in range reroll a single damage per charge used. Any creature in the furthest range can have a single die manipulated once, any creature inside the inner range can have any number of die manipulated. This bracelet can only manipulate die involved in determining damage dealt.

name: Rurgo's Alchemy Extensions
description: Seems to be bearing Conjuration and Transmutation magics, this set of vials and mixing tools seem augment those of an Alchemist's Kit. These additions greatly improve one's ability to create alchemical concoctions. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
hiddenDescription: A set of vials and mixing equipment seemingly meant to extend those of an Alchemist's Kit. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
note: Cursed with Rurgo's ghost, any attempts to use it without befriending him result in an additional -${10,orange}$ to Alchemist Kit checks. Additionally, Rurgo being a jester of sorts, occasionally brews innocuous bombs of sorts, causing ones pack or room to occasionally explode with smoke or the like. Rurgo's alignment was that of Adjuration. Once befriended and calmed the negative modifier is removed and the surprise bombs ceasee. The user also gains advantage when brewing Abjuration potions.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Luck's Future
description: Runic symbols for luck seem to decorate each card of the deck, calling on Luck's Grace for the reader. You may make a tarot reading of any creature or yourself. However, when performing a reading on yourself, roll 3 d20s to determine the Skill Checks that are effected (Or perform an actual Tarot Reading) and after each roll, perform a skill check and note the saved rolls that you can use later to replace any roll for that skill check: 1. Acrobatics 2. Animal Handling 2. Arcana 2. Athletics 2. Concentration 2. Deception 2. History 2. Initiative 2. Insight 2. Intimidation 2. Investigation 2. Medicine 2. Nature 2. Perception 2. Performance 2. Persuasion 2. Religion 2. Sleight of Hand 2. Stealth 2. Survival Any skill check made over the day can be replaced by the saved roll. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
hiddenDescription: An intriguing set of tarot cards with runic tapestry. You managed to unlock the encasing field on Umqavum 21, 318Session 41.
note: When used without befriending Grace, a laugh can be heard and the creature suffers a critical fail. If replacing a critical fail, the creature also suffers 2d6 Psychic damage. To befriend Grace, must attune with the bracers and only use the rolls for things she sees fit. Grace's Loves: + Animals + Song + Writing + History

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Banner of Power
description:
A special banner that can be thrust into the ground as an action at any time, channeling arcane power to those near-by.

Creatures in the banner's radius have advantage on normal and magical attack rolls. Creatures in the extended range only have advantage on normal attacks.

This banner has ${10,orange}$HP and ${10+int,orange}$AC while planted and, once placed, can not be retrieved until combat has ended. Once retrieved, the banner is considered healed.

Only ${1,orange}$ banner may be active for you and your allies at a time. If multiple are placed, the first one simply ceases to apply its effect. It may still be collected after the battle and retains its enchanting effect.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Seer's Glasses
description: A pair of runic glass lenses are set in this golden frame. A charge can be used as an Action to see the true form of any creature or object for ${2*wis,orange}$ minutes. When a charge is used, roll a Perception check. Any object or creature that is not hiding will be revealed, however those that have made a Stealth check will only be fully visible if you beat their roll. Otherwise you will see nothing or they will appear as "distorted" but you will not be able to make out their true form. Limited only by your normal vision. Can extend through non-magical Spyglasses, however magical ones will require an Arcana check to handle the multiple magics effectively.
note:
Expensive for the number of enchantments present and the lack of attunement

+ 1 Enchantment per lense
+ 1 For the frame to carry the sight
+ 1 For sustaining the sight
+ 1 To allude Attunement

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Bracers of Separation
description: Each bracer is composed of 2 rings that interlock magically. While attuned, each may be separated as an Action (2 Actions to separate both). The bracers allow you to maintain control of your hands and you continue to feel sensations from them as normal. The separation is painless though it may take some getting used to for controlling your hands (Sleight of Hand). Should you lose attunement while your hands are separated however it is as though your hands have been cut off at the bracers.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Shattered Power
description: A large heavy war hammer with a specially crafted back to the hammers head piece that allows a power crystal to be locked into place. While attuned and wielding this, you additionally critical on a ${19,orange}$ When a crystal is inserted, this war hammer resets to max charges. The crystal is consumed and not usable after being attached, however it can be removed, at which point it disintegrates if any part of it is left. When striking a creature, on a critical, a charge can be spent, a burst of energy exploding forth from the war hammer and fracturing the crystal. The effect varies with the power crystal that is used. + **Red**: Explodes for in a fiery flash in a 10 stud radius around you dealing 2d6 Fire damage (Not multiplied by the critical) to all creatures in the area except you. These creatures make a Dexterity DC${10+wis,orange}$ saving throw and take half damage on success. + **Blue**: Up to ${wis,orange}$ creatures of your choice in ${30,orange}$ studs of you receive 6d6 Temporary HP. + **Green**: Deal an additional 1d8 Poison damage (Multiplied with the critical strike as usual) and heals you for 2d6 damage. + **Orange**: Unknown + **Lime**: Unknown + **Silver**: Unknown + **Gold**: Unknown
note: A weapon of the ancient blacksmiths of old, this is the last of its kind and its knowledgeis lost to time.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Decree
description: Spells cast through this wand exert a great pressure over those struck by the spell. When dealing damage with a spell cast through this wand, each creature receives an additional 1d4 Psychic damage, regardless of how many creatures are struck. When casting a single target spell, a charge can be used to submit the target to an additional Constitution save against your Spell DC and on failure, that creature loses ${1,orange}$d6 worth of spell slots (1 Level 6, or 6 Level 1s, any combination totaling the rolled value in levels).

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Wandering Dust
description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${20,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${20*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Cape of Invisibility
description: While heavier than it looks, this cape allows the attuned to become invisible for a period of time equal to your ${Wisdom,orange}$ Modifier (${wis,orange}$) in hours when a charge is used. This invisibility is ended when you take any Action. Use of multiple charges does not stack, the invisibility merely ends the duration of time from the last used charge. If the cape is and removed while the invisibility is active, the invisibility ends, and the cape can be removed by force while you are invisible. The invisibility does not extend to any other creature, regardless of that creature's position to you.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Amnesia Dust
description:
Dust slowly fills the pouch using the excess energy from the attuned creature.

When a creature is exposed to the dust, it must make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${8 + wis,orange}$ save or forget the last ${minute,orange}$ from its memory.

However the dust is difficult to handle and you may expose yourself to the dust. When used, make a ${Sleight,orange}$ ${of,orange}$ ${Hand,orange}$ DC${10-dex,orange}$ Skill Check, and on failure you also forget the last minute.

Any creature effected by forgetfulness has its memory restored when exposed to a Level ${3,orange}$ or higher healing spell.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Displacer Chest
description: Created from the fur of a magical Displacer Beast, when struck a charge can be used to immediately phase yourself into the Ethereal Plane, phasing back after the damage has passed. Area of effect attacks and other such dangers that have more of a persistence damage (Such as Flame Sphere) can have a charge used to immediately succeed the saving throw, however this can not be used after you've rolled for the save as it would be too late. Can hold charges equal to your Dexterity plus your Intelligence Modifiers.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Grave Ender
description: An extremely large and heavy hammer said to have been created by the ancients and identified by the three runes in the hammer's head piece seemingly laid as liquid power crystal, one of red, one of blue, and one of green. Any creature struck dead by this war hammer is Laid to Rest. In addition to not being revivable, the corpse can not be used in anyway. When striking with this hammer, its command word can be spoken to use a charge and invoke one of the 3 runes in the hammer, only 1 rune may be invoked at a time. ### Red The strike deals an additional 2d12 Necrotic damage. ### Blue The target is Silenced for ${1,orange}$ minute. There is no save unless the creature has special resistances. ### Green You heal for ${(con*10)%,orange}$ of the total damage dealt.
note: If Ancient is known, any number of runes can be invoked in a single strike, but each rune still consumes a charge. If all three runes are invoked at once, the creature is Marked for Death and will suffer the curse of being Laid to Rest when it dies. There is no terminal duration to Laid to Rest, however it is a curse. Command Word: "Oblivion" in any language

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Speech Pills of the Lower Realms
description: Pill to learn a new language. The general instructions are listed in several languages, including common, however the ritual listed seems to require understanding Ancient to perform accurately, but enough is explained to try. If you don't understand Ancient, make a Wisdom DC${25,orange}$ Save. On success, you learn a language of your choice from below. However a critical failure will result in your brain being overwhelmed and you will take 5d10 Psychic damage. If you do understand Ancient, you may simply choose a new language to learn. Learn one of the languages of the lower realms, the Elemental Planes, The Four Hells, and Reykurax, listed below: + Aquan + Primordial + Infernal + Abyssal
hiddenDescription: Some weird symbols mark the box, they appear to be in ancient.
note: Inscriptions match the languages on the Lower part of  the Citadel entrance

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Spirit's Vow: Meowsaton
description: A silver bracelet with a Blue Power Crystal inlaid with small runic script in the silver that you know to read "Meowston" and a small cat toy dangling from it. While attuned to this bracelet, you perform an Animal Handling skill check every morning, adding the rolled value to this item's charges. Once at 100 charges, a spirit cat appears for you; Meowsaton. After appearing, you continue to perform an Animal Handling every morning, but this now determines what Meowsaton will do that day: + Critical Failure: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, all creatures can hear him and all creature can see him. Even if the bracelet is unattuned, he will continue to exist and pester you, even through your sleep, should you manage to sleep. + 0-5: Spends the day following you around meowing for food, however only you can see or hear him. When you attempt to sleep, roll a d100 for every hour you are asleep, on a 20 or less, Meowsaton wakes you by pawing your face, distinctly asking for food. + 6-10: Quietly stalks the area around you looking for treats or presents. creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Icy Presence
description: A frost enchanted necklace that makes your presence fairly known, but is ideal for the cold. Your body temperature is always stable and cool, in the arctic or a desert, but Fire & Cold damage still hurt, though cold much less. You also can not be set on fire or frozen. You have recently learned that this necklace once belonged to the King of an old kingdom called Hintobin. Formed after the fall of the ancient empires but fell more than a hundred years ago. In your search of the lore of this necklace, you learned that it has a connection to ancient officers of the law who would pursue criminals and that many had a necklace such as this and used it to help restrain their person's of interest. That ancient power is still within this necklace, though the ways to reach it seem lost to time. In witnessing the history of the necklace, you saw the King of Hintobin perform a powerful Fireball spell using ${6,orange}$ Red Power Crystals in a circular formation around his arm, seemingly aided by the necklace. As your vision progressed, you saw a rather large city seemingly wiped from existence by the spell before the lore of the necklace seemed to jump forward to it lost at sea before being picked up my merchants.

description: Made of a smooth metal and bearing crystalline runes in its neck, this cello gives off a faint blue glow when held. Requires care and maintenance to keep her in tune. If you're attuned to this cello and have it in both hands (or in one hand with the other hand free), you can play (or continue playing) a tune on this cello as a Bonus Action. Folk Tune: Advantage on Wisdom saves and History checks to all friendly creatures who can hear you. 2. Jazz Tune: Advantage on Persuasion checks to all friendly creatures who can hear you. 3. Rock Tune: Advantage on Attack rolls to all friendly creatures who can hear you. You may know other tunes with other effects, check your Knowledge to see. The headstock also seems to have a socket for a power crystal...

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Ring of Symphony
description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Proxio's Mandate
description: Woven by an old wizard, Proxio. These bracers help an able bodied spell caster to maintain their composure. As an Action, you can recover a single spell slot. You suffer 2d8 + 4 Necrotic damage per level of spell slot restored. For instance, a Level 1 slot can recovered by suffering 2d8 + 4. A Level 2 for 4d8 + 8, or a Level 4 for 8d8 + 16. Should you fall unconscious after use, you still have the spell slot on being revived. You can not recover a spell slot to which you do not have access.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Amnesia Dust
description:
Dust slowly fills the pouch using the excess energy from the attuned creature.

When a creature is exposed to the dust, it must make a ${Wisdom,orange}$ DC${8 + wis,orange}$ save or forget the last ${minute,orange}$ from its memory.

However the dust is difficult to handle and you may expose yourself to the dust. When used, make a ${Sleight,orange}$ ${of,orange}$ ${Hand,orange}$ DC${10-dex,orange}$ Skill Check, and on failure you also forget the last minute.

Any creature effected by forgetfulness has its memory restored when exposed to a Level ${3,orange}$ or higher healing spell.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Andiziyo
description:
Seemingly just the hilt of a blade. As you examine it, the hilt produces an energy like blade. A culmination of the souls of all the creatures its slain, the blade of this dagger is a long purple beam. The beam giving no resistance or weight, causing it to behave like a dagger instead of a swird.

At the beginning of combat, make a ${Constitution,orange}$ DC${20-level,orange}$ save. On failure, using this blade causes 1d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage with every strike as the blade drains your life force to power itself. Alternatively, a ${"content":"Red","class":"rs-red"}$ or ${"content":"Blue","class":"rs-blue"}$ ${"content":"Power Crystal","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ may be attached to the blade to satisfy the needs of the blade.

If a crystal is attached, roll 1d12 at the end of any combat. On a ${12,orange}$, the crystal shatters.

When a creature is slain by you, its life force is absorbed by this blade. This hilt is treated as the corpse of the dead for the purposes of things like ${"content":"Speak with the Dead","class":"rs-darkorange"}$ or ${"content":"Gentle Repose","class":"rs-darkorange"}$.

When striking, charges can be expended from the hilt to various effects:
+ ${1,orange}$ Charge: Add ${1,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage
+ ${2,orange}$ Charges: If you've managed to hit, the hit is a critical hit
+ ${3,orange}$ Charges: Add ${3*wis,orange}$d12 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage

If this blade is used while not attuned, the creature using the blade takes ${4,orange}$d8 ${Necrotic,orange}$ damage for every attack.
hiddenDescription: A purple runic handle with runic symbols inlaid along the hilt.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Researcher's Note
description: We've lost control of the creatures, I'm leaving this note for the members who come to continue our research. What follows is smeared in blood, partially written in ink, runic symbols seem to be the important part. Some of the runes seem to have been finished in blood... Examining the runes, you've made out that the runes outline an enchantment ritual, partially in Ancient.
note:

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: See Journal: Researcher's Note: Resistances
description:
The Crystalline properties seem to result in the spiders acquiring a random set of resistances. Ironically the larger the size, the greater the number of resistances I observed, though the smaller spiders seem to be more capable of damage than the larger ones.

Small spiders seem to have 1 to 2 resistances while medium ones seem to always have 3, and a larger one seems to get up to 5 resistances.

Medium rolls until it has 3 unique resistances, where small and large merely roll 2 and 5 times respectively.

Resistance observed below (determined by 1d12):
1. Acid 
1. Cold 
1. Fire 
1. Force 
1. Holy 
1. Lightning 
1. Necrotic 
1. Poison 
1. Psychic 
1. Radiant 
1. Sonic 
1. Thunder

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: See Journal: Researcher's Note: Instabilities
description: The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. On death, they seem to merely disperse, leaving no corpse. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. According to my measurements the detonation is as follows: [Spider Size Multiplier] * ( [Spider HP] + [Damage Received] ) Sizing Multiplier: + Small: 3 + Medium: 2 + Large: 1 The type of damage seems to follow the crystal being expressed, though I've only managed to craft a measurable experiment for Red and Blue properties, I hope to produce the same for Orange soon once we receive our shipment from the Caravan. + Red: Fire + Blue: Cold
hiddenDescription: There seem to be some notes about various spider parts, but the handwriting is difficult to read...

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Wandering Dust
description:
Allows the attuned creature to pull forth a handful of dust that can be cast across a floor, wall, or ceiling to create a portal.

To complete a portal, one handful of dust must be laid out somewhere and a small arcane chant said over it where a ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check is made. Then, in another location no more than ${40,orange}$ times your ${"content":"Wisdom","class":"rs-orange"}$ Modifier studs away (${40*wis,orange}$), another handful of dust can be scattered and another ${"content":"Arcana","class":"rs-orange"}$ Check made.

On success, a Portal is created that connects the 2 locations and allows at least ${int,orange}$ number of creatures through before collapsing, but may allow more.

The stability and success of the portal depend on a number of factors determined by where the portal is created and the difficulty involved will vary according. However, on a completely open unoccupied field, the portal can not fail to create.

<sub>There have been cases reported of people traveling through the portal finding themselves briefly in another realm and coming out with moderate ${"content":"Fire","class":"rs-orange"}$ or ${"content":"Poison","class":"rs-orange"}$ damage that seems to related to issues with portal stability.</sub>

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Gravesend Research Journal
description: --- # Sections --- Eldith managed to read the book while everyone else was training, revealing all the sections. + √ - About Resistances + √ - About Instability + √ - About Liquified Crystals + √ - About Spider Health + √ - About Spider Damage + √ - About Crystalline Glows --- # About Resistances --- The Crystalline properties seem to result in the spiders acquiring a random set of resistances. Ironically the larger the size, the greater the number of resistances I observed, though the smaller spiders seem to be more capable of damage than the larger ones. Small spiders seem to have 1 to 2 resistances while medium ones seem to always have 3, and a larger one seems to get up to 5 resistances. Medium rolls until it has 3 unique resistances, where small and large merely roll 2 and 5 times respectively. Resistance observed below (determined by 1d12): 1. Acid 1. Cold 1. Fire 1. Force 1. Holy 1. Lightning 1. Necrotic 1. Poison 1. Psychic 1. Radiant 1. Sonic 1. Thunder --- # About Instability --- The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. On death, they seem to merely disperse, leaving no corpse. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. According to my measurements the detonation is as follows: [Spider Size Multiplier] * ( [Spider HP] + [Damage Received] ) Sizing Multiplier: + Small: 3 + Medium: 2 + Large: 1 The type of damage seems to follow the crystal being expressed, though I've only managed to craft a measurable experiment for Red and Blue properties, I hope to produce the same for Orange soon once we receive our shipment from the Caravan. + Red: Fire + Blue: Cold --- # About Liquified Crystals --- We are running low on our supply of liquified crystals and will need a new shipment from the syndicate soon, I suspect it will cost some 100,000G to get it secured and safely to the lab. As I understand it, we are running low on our supply as a whole. The encyclopedias should have the information necessary for the liquification process as well as the rituals for combining the raw elements to create such vials as well. --- # About Spider Health --- Observing the spiders, they are quite hostile to other creatures and special containment has been necessary to allow us to study them effectively. Phasing them into an observable pocket dimension has proven useful as we are able to control what goes in and out, though the spiders do appear to weaken after a period inside the pocket dimension, even with adequate nutrient being pumped inside. What follows here-in is a ritual to create a controlled pocket dimension inside a simple cage. The enchantment seems to handle pumped air through the realm as well. Details on how to insert and remove objects appears to be detailed and extremely complicated, however seems to involve the use of 7th level spells. Under observation, the various sizes of the spiders seem to be proportional to their health. + Crystalline: 48 - 104 (40+8d8) + Small: 70 - 95 (65 + 5d6) + Medium: 105 - 130 (100 + 5d6) + Large: 125 - 150 (120 + 5d6) + Giant: 168 - 240 (160 + 8d10) + Monstrous: 320 - 500 (300 + 20d10) Unfortunately, we were not able to grow a crystalline spider much larger than a small one, but judging by the ferocity of its bite, we currently presume it to be more than enough. --- # About Spider Damage --- The damage the spiders can inflict from their mere fangs is as one would expect, the large the creature, the larger the fangs. However spiders towering over our larger ones seem more docile and are much slower. While I've witnessed them crush a panther to death and eat it whole, I'm not convinced a non-sedated panther could not kill one, or at least escape it. The larger ones and the smaller variants seem to possess the aggression we desire. Their base damage seems to be as follows (Ignoring stat bonuses and other effects imparted from their crystalline properties): + Large: 4d12 + Medium: 3d10 + Small: 2d8 The intriguing difference comes about their expression of their crystalline properties. Additionally, smaller creatures in all our experiments seemed to follow this rule so we expect similar results as we apply this to other creatures. Researching the Red Power Crystal effects, we observed the fang bites to have these properties: + Large: 1d8 Fire + Medium: 2d10 Fire + Small: 6d6 Fire As a special case, we were somewhat able to observe a Red Crystalline Spider but measurement proved problematic, however our highest measurement was ${68,orange}$: 11 Piercing and 57 Fire. All of that while still possessing the ability to poison a creature with its toxins. --- # About Crystalline Glows --- In allowing the crystalline spiders to breed, there seems to be a rare mutation that results in a seemingly White Glow accompanying its normal glow, giving them a lighter tint. I believe this is a spontaneous result in line with the text and rituals of the Divina Arcana, but without the text I can not confirm. Further research on these spiders may be a way to achieve parts of our goal without the Artifacts, but suspect this will take some time. I've arranged transport of half a dozen crystalline spiders that exhibit this glow to several other research outposts for further study. However be careful, they can appear docilie, but seem to be able to escape the dimensional cages if additional measurers aren't taken and refreshed periodically. The entry the continues with a set of arcane circles denoting a level 5 spel: Dimensional Containment
hiddenDescription: A research journal from Gravesend, appears to be written in Abyssal and seems to contain a number of notes and diagrams. May take some time to read and likely reveal some information. --- A research journal from Gravesend, appears to be written in Abyssal and seems to contain a number of notes and diagrams. Each section seems large enough to take a few hours to read and understand and a cursory check shows there appear to be several... --- Per Section: + ${5 - (dex/2), orange}$ Hours Reading, reduced by half your Dexterity modifier + Investigation Check DC${18,orange}$ to understand (Reduced by your Wisdom Modifier (${wis,orange}$) per failed check of that section) + Comprehension of Abyssal

Small spiders seem to have 1 to 2 resistances while medium ones seem to always have 3, and a larger one seems to get up to 5 resistances. Medium rolls until it has 3 unique resistances, where small and large merely roll 2 and 5 times respectively. Resistance observed below (determined by 1d12): 1. Acid 1. Cold 1. Fire 1. Force 1. Holy 1. Lightning 1. Necrotic 1. Poison 1. Psychic 1. Radiant 1. Sonic 1. Thunder --- # About Instability --- The crystalline properties present in the spiders, while appropriately dangerous, also appears to be somewhat unstable. On death, they seem to merely disperse, leaving no corpse. Which, while desired to leave no evidence of their incursions, has the added benefit of causing them to detonate on death when expressing the crystalline energy. This detonation seems to be inherent to their mass. Oddly, having the size to spread out the mass seems to help reduce the explosion size rather than increase it. According to my measurements the detonation is as follows: [Spider Size Multiplier] * ( [Spider HP] + [Damage Received] ) Sizing Multiplier: + Small: 3 + Medium: 2 + Large: 1 The type of damage seems to follow the crystal being expressed, though I've only managed to craft a measurable experiment for Red and Blue properties, I hope to produce the same for Orange soon once we receive our shipment from the Caravan. + Red: Fire + Blue: Cold --- # About Liquified Crystals --- We are running low on our supply of liquified crystals and will need a new shipment from the syndicate soon, I suspect it will cost some 100,000G to get it secured and safely to the lab. As I understand it, we are running low on our supply as a whole. The encyclopedias should have the information necessary for the liquification process as well as the rituals for combining the raw elements to create such vials as well. --- # About Spider Health --- Observing the spiders, they are quite hostile to other creatures and special containment has been necessary to allow us to study them effectively. Phasing them into an observable pocket dimension has proven useful as we are able to control what goes in and out, though the spiders do appear to weaken after a period inside the pocket dimension, even with adequate nutrient being pumped inside. What follows here-in is a ritual to create a controlled pocket dimension inside a simple cage. The enchantment seems to handle pumped air through the realm as well. Details on how to insert and remove objects appears to be detailed and extremely complicated, however seems to involve the use of 7th level spells. Under observation, the various sizes of the spiders seem to be proportional to their health. + Crystalline: 48 - 104 (40+8d8) + Small: 70 - 95 (65 + 5d6) + Medium: 105 - 130 (100 + 5d6) + Large: 125 - 150 (120 + 5d6) + Giant: 168 - 240 (160 + 8d10) + Monstrous: 320 - 500 (300 + 20d10) Unfortunately, we were not able to grow a crystalline spider much larger than a small one, but judging by the ferocity of its bite, we currently presume it to be more than enough. --- # About Spider Damage --- The damage the spiders can inflict from their mere fangs is as one would expect, the large the creature, the larger the fangs. However spiders towering over our larger ones seem more docile and are much slower. While I've witnessed them crush a panther to death and eat it whole, I'm not convinced a non-sedated panther could not kill one, or at least escape it. The larger ones and the smaller variants seem to possess the aggression we desire. Their base damage seems to be as follows (Ignoring stat bonuses and other effects imparted from their crystalline properties): + Large: 4d12 + Medium: 3d10 + Small: 2d8 The intriguing difference comes about their expression of their crystalline properties. Additionally, smaller creatures in all our experiments seemed to follow this rule so we expect similar results as we apply this to other creatures. Researching the Red Power Crystal effects, we observed the fang bites to have these properties: + Large: 1d8 Fire + Medium: 2d10 Fire + Small: 6d6 Fire As a special case, we were somewhat able to observe a Red Crystalline Spider but measurement proved problematic, however our highest measurement was ${68,orange}$: 11 Piercing and 57 Fire. All of that while still possessing the ability to poison a creature with its toxins. --- # About Crystalline Glows --- In allowing the crystalline spiders to breed, there seems to be a rare mutation that results in a seemingly White Glow accompanying its normal glow, giving them a lighter tint. I believe this is a spontaneous result in line with the text and rituals of the Divina Arcana, but without the text I can not confirm. Further research on these spiders may be a way to achieve parts of our goal without the Artifacts, but suspect this will take some time. I've arranged transport of half a dozen crystalline spiders that exhibit this glow to several other research outposts for further study. However be careful, they can appear docilie, but seem to be able to escape the dimensional cages if additional measurers aren't taken and refreshed periodically. The entry the continues with a set of arcane circles denoting a level 5 spel: Dimensional Containment

name: Iphindawo
description: An old enchanted Elvish parchment of location. Once per day, a Wisdom save against this parchment and speak 1 word. The map reveals near-by locations of particular creatures or things based on the last spoken word and its interpretation there of. Range seems to be approximately ${5000,orange}$ studs but is subject to some natural and magical barriers. Once the map reaches any indicated point, the map turns off until the next day.
hiddenDescription: An old looking parchment that has a small glowing dot on it that seems to lie behind the barrier.
note:
+ Red Crystal: More damage against the tracked creature or object (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Blue: Tracks additional instances (Wis) (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Green: Reveal surrounding terrain (Crystal consumed on a 1d6 6)
+ Orange: (Consumes the Crystal) and Teleports the holder to the nearest occupiable space closest to the closest dot. 1 crystal per creature holding the scroll.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Reusable Spell Ink
description:
A magical well of Spell Copying Ink that slowly recharges over time as you rest.

When copying a spell, a charge may be used instead of an inkwell, however each charge can only be used as 1 inkwell for the purposes of copying at any given time.

While rare to find, multiple of these inkwells maybe used at once and multiple can be carried by a single creature.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Ring of Symphony
description: A golden resonating band with the slightest hum, considered a Symphonic ring. When worn and attuned, your body relieved by the hum. Whenever you suffer damage, the amount that isn't mitigated by resistances and such is then divided up among all other Symphonic rings that can hear the cry of this one. This damage can not be mitigated. Things to note: + Unattuning takes an Action to perform + The ring must be able to hear, this is independent of the attuned creature + Damage does still split to an unconscious creature, however after it dies the attunement is lost and therefore no longer split

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Skeleton Key
description:
A magical shifting key, known to quite adept at opening locks, in some cases even magical ones. However, once used, they almost always break, even if the lock in question was already unlocked or was quite simple.

They do however require a lock on which to operate. If no keyhole exists or the keyhole is jammed with broken lockpicks from previous attempts, this key can not be used.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Gimsteinn
description: A smooth and extremely well balanced, the blade is seemingly composed of nothing but the frost of air and the quilon formed from a blue power crystal, lending only more greatness to its balance. When struck by this blade, the frostly apparition that is the blade pierces almost all barriers and chills the victim. When thrown, the blade stays where it lands, but as long as the attuned maintains a free hand, on any Attack Action they can instead command the dagger to attack, from where it lay, any creature of which the attuned is reasonably aware. If the target of this special attack is further than ${200,orange}$ studs from you, this Attack Action is at disadvantage. If you can not see the creature but are aware of it, such as around a corner, then the target gets +5 Armor. This special Attack Action replaces the attack but still counts as an attack. So a Bonus Attack Action with a light weapon can still occur. If you have Extra Attack, this special action replaces only one of the Attack Actions. You also possess two special Actions to "move" the dagger. One to move the dagger to a special pocket dimension. Another to pull the dagger to your hand from the special pocket dimension. If you unattune from the dagger while it is in the pocket dimension, it appears at your feet.
hiddenDescription: An ornate dagger with a blue crystalline quilon.
note:
A legendary dagger wielded by the once great assassin Mondum Eruedel, forged by Via as a special request.

The dagger was created while Via was still in service to Crane Vox and has special divination magic hidden into it. Mondum was later killed by Lemuli after stealing magical scrolls from Crane.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Frickiyzie
description:
Potent pills that cause you to see otherworldly things. Enjoyed by dropping the pills into a large cauldron and enjoying the sugary beverage that comes forth.

Known to be quite messy. Partially from boiling over. Partially from the intoxicated spilling their drinks.

The shop keeps always note that the pills expire after some time, causing them to have no effect.
hiddenDescription: Unknown effects
note: Created from liquified power crystals, Curell sits on enchanted land created by Durong (Crane Vox) and in Curell these pills show other beings in an adjacent plane. These pills have no effect outside of Curell, but their secretive nature and that of Curell keeps many from noticing and the few that do assume they have a "bad batch" or that the pills have "gone bad".

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Rasping Blade
description: A hearty blade seeming coated in a dark shadow. When a creature takes Necrotic damage from this blade, the attuned creature heals for that much damage.
hiddenDescription: A haunting dark shadow follows the blade of this sword.
note: If wielded by someone who is not a devoted follower of Cthulhu, when healed this way, the user is slowly corrupted gaining 1 point of corruption per point healed. If the corruption reaches the max hp of the user they are cursed and can no longer heal dying over 3 rounds after which their corpse is animated and turned into a servant of Cthulhu. Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Wallmaker
description: Seemingly simple heavy plate armor enchanted with protection magic. A charge may be used to instantly construct a ${10,orange}$ stud wide, ${5,orange}$ stud high, ${1,orange}$ stud thick wall centered on you up to 5 studs away and can not intersect with a creature (alive or dead). Any number of charges can be used at once to construct a wall with additional length, height, or thickness. The wall is considered magical and persists for ${con,orange}$ minutes. Once constructed, you are not able to dismiss the wall though Dispel Magic and similar effects will instantly remove it. If the wall intersects with prexisting terrain, buildings, or other features it stops at them either meeting flush with them to finish its construction or stopping at them depending on the nature of the impediment. Max charges scale with your Constitution modifier (${con,orange}$).

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Render's Chakram
description: A little known but complex weapon. Can be thrown very accurately at short distances or simply used similar to a dagger. Works the same in main hand or off hand. When attacking, you may choose up to 3 targets and the order in which they will be struck. Each must be within range of the weapon from the last struck creature. These must be chosen before your attack is made. Additionally, any charges to be used must be chosen before attacks are made as well. Once you've chosen your attacks, make your Attack roll. On success, the Chakram hits and heads toward the next target or returns to you. On failure, the creature that was struck can make a Dexterity save against your Attack roll, and on success catches the Chakram. A critical failure on your Attack roll results in the Chakram falling to the ground at the target. If you fail 2 hits in a row, the Chakram flies off in a random direction. If the direction is towards you, it is not considered catchable. A single failure in a thrown attack results in the Chakram returning but requiring a Dexterity save to catch, with DC 10 * [Number of targets]. If the save is failed, you take the weapon's damage and it falls to your feet. When a creature is struck by this Chakrum, it must make a Constitution save at 36 / ( 1 + [Number of Targets]), and on failure receive the Bleeding effect and bleed for 1d6 Slashing damage per round until a save is successful or until healed.

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Disarming Gloves
description: Made of enchanted leather, the gloves are resistant to damage and may be used a few times a day to attempt to disarm an attacker using a weapon that is ${8,orange}$ blocks in size or smaller. On a failed Attack against you, you may make a Sleight of Hand roll against the Attack roll and on success, the attacker's weapon is thrown to the ground. If you have a free hand, you may instead opt to take the weapon into your free hand if the weapon is usable in that situation. As a limited set of examples, an offhand weapon must be 6 blocks or smaller, or if the weapon would cause you to exceed your carry capacity. More cases exist. The maximum number of charges scales with your Dexterity modifier (${dex,orange}$).

creator: 585c68bfd5e06ab07fba8401
name: Rasping Blade (NPC)
description: A hearty blade seeming coated in a dark shadow. When a creature takes Necrotic damage from this blade, the attuned creature heals for that much damage.
hiddenDescription: A haunting dark shadow follows the blade of this sword.
note: If wielded by someone who is not a devoted follower of Cthulhu, when healed this way, the user is slowly corrupted gaining 1 point of corruption per point healed. If the corruption reaches the max hp of the user they are cursed and can no longer heal dying over 3 rounds after which their corpse is animated and turned into a servant of Cthulhu. Decursing the creature removes the curse and the corpse drops to the ground. If decursed before being animated, the curse drops and they immediately count as dead. The corpse counts as dead starting from when they were first animated.

Trying to get Mrs. Dinoir to safety + Do you know who the investigators Mrs. Dinoir hired? Athis and Cesis + Was there anything unusual about the carriage you drove yesterday? note: Decapitated on Alucevum 8, 319

name: Blessing of Cthulhu
description: An artifact blessed by Cthulhu for his priests to carry while manifested in other realms. A single charge can used as an Action or a Reaction to move one effect from one creature to another. If the effect was created by a level ${7,orange}$ spell or higher, you must make a Charisma save against the original caster's spell DC unless a power crystal is channeled with this blessing. If you are a Priest of Cthulhu, a charge can be used at anytime to instill chaos on the battle field. Roll 1d100 to pull energy from Skapari, the realm of discord. If you are not a Priest of the God of Chaos, then this effect triggers randomly.
note:
+ 1-15: Random explosions on the battle field for 3d6 Fire Damage
+ 16-33: 1d6 creatures swap positions
+ 34-56: All saves are inverted (Fails are saves and saves are fails). You have disadvantage on all Saves.
+ 57-84: AC is inverted. All attacks against you are at advantage.
+ 85-99: Pools of Liquid Power Crystal span randomly.
+ 100: All beneficial buffs for your foes that are not divine or infused with Power Crystals are nullified
